question: Question_05_(a)
statement:
Find the standard matrix of the linear transformation of
\textbf{R}\textsuperscript{3} which reflects across the \emph{yz}-plane.
sols:
To find the standard matrix of this linear transformation, we simply
consider the image of the three base vectors.

The vector {[}1, 0, 0{]} is sent to the vector {[}-1, 0, 0{]} and the
vectors {[}0, 1, 0{]} and {[}0, 0, 1{]} simply remain where they are
(since they belong to the \emph{yz}-plane itself). Hence the standard
matrix of this linear transformation is

\begin{align*}\left[ \begin{array}{ccc}
-1 & 0 & 0\\
0 & 1 & 0 \\
0 & 0 & 1
\end{array}\right]\end{align*}
hints:
What does this transformation do to the three basis vectors {[}1,0,0{]},
{[}0,1,0{]}, and {[}0,0,1{]}?
